item.title: Who We Are
item.dc:creator: goblin
item.content:encoded:
Who We Are

Rostam law is a virtual general practice law firm. This means we provide experienced attorneys that fit most legal needs without the unwanted accouterments of traditional law firms. Specifically, we do not provide our attorneys with mandatory salaries and offices. Instead, our attorneys work remotely or at the client’s office, and are only paid when actually providing legal services. This is a manifestation of our dedication to a lean structure.

Rostam's knack for technology also allows us to be client focused. Rostam provides our clients with, the option, to use a "cloud based" portal to access their documents at anytime, wherever they have internet access. Rostam’s use of the cloud is a prime example of how leveraging technology can improve sustainability while enhancing client satisfaction.

Rostam understands that each business and individual's legal needs are distinct. Therefore, it is not enough to simply provide an experienced attorney; let Rostam use its knowledge to bring predictability to your budget. Rostam encourages alternative fee arrangements, and creates custom arrangements tailored to each client’s circumstances.

Finally, as lawyers we understand that we have a heightened duty to Charity and the Environment. In an effort to fulfill these duties, Rostam donates 10% of its profits to reputable charities.

Alternative Fee Arrangements

Charity Commitment

Enviornmental Initiative

Alternative Fee Arrangements

Rostam's fee arrangements are the new paradigm for legal billing. Fee arrangements are customized according to each client's distinct matter and preferences. Alternatively, Rostam offers standard hourly rates. The alternative arrangements can be broken down into several types such as a the Pure Contingency Fee, Partial Contingency Fee, Fixed Fee, Holdback/Success Fee, and other arrangements. However Rostam is not limited by these categories and is eager to create hybrid arrangements based on client concerns.

Pure Contingency Fee

Pure contingency fee arrangements are traditional arrangements in which we receive a fixed or scaled percentage of recoveries from a client's lawsuit. These arrangements are often appropriate when the client has limited resources to finance its litigation.

Partial Contingency Fee

Partial contingency fee arrangements are arrangements in which we receive a discounted portion of our hourly rates plus a smaller percentage of any recoveries or outcome in a client's matter.

Fixed Fee or Flat Fee

Fixed of flat fee arrangements are arrangements in which we agree to handle a client's matter for a lump sum or a fixed monthly rate. These arrangements are often appropriate when the client desires to obtain more certainty with their legal budgets. The nature of the fixed or flat fee arrangement can be tailored to fit any given client matter.

Holdback or Success Fee

Holdback or Success Fee arrangements are arrangements in which we are paid a portion of fees up front, with a portion withheld contingent upon the success of a matter. This fee structure is a great example of how we are able to minimize the legal and outcome risks for our clients.

Other arrangements

We are not limited to any set of arrangements and are amendable to negotiate a fee arrangement that are customized to fit the client's needs. For example, we offer multiple matter arrangements in which we utilize differing fee arrangements based on the matter type.

Charity Commitment

"Every man must decide whether he will walk in the light of creative altruism or in the darkness of destructive selfishness"
- Martin Luther King Jr.

Rostam understands that businesses are inevitably linked to the communities in which they operate. The people and animals within a community are the true catalysts for business success. That is why we have committed to donate 10% of our profits to charity. This is the least we can do to give back to society as a business. In the long term Rostam hopes to create a nonprofit, funded by this commitment to charity, charged with improving quality of life through a focus on health and education.

Pro Bono

Part of the Rostam culture is to act as quasi-public servants in the representation of the underprivileged, oppressed, and defenseless. Rostam extents a requirement of the California attorney oath to all its attorneys: never to reject, for any consideration personal to himself or herself, the cause of the defenseless or the oppressed. Rostam seeks to ingrain this duty into the minds of our lawyers. We encourage our lawyers to accept pro bono representation whenever the opportunity presents itself. In fact, Rostam mandates that its attorneys satisfy any aspirational pro bono commitment in the states they are licensed to practice.

Enviornmental Initiative

Businesses rely on the environment in which they operate. We understand the importance of the environment to Rostam's success. We therefore work to eliminate our emissions footprint by limiting emission causing activities and also purchasing carbon offsets or utilizing alternative energy sources.

Paperless Firm

Rostam is nearly a paperless firm. We have successfully implemented a secure "cloud based" file management portal for all documents. In addition, clients have access to this portal in order to view all documents related to their matters, if they so choose.

Benefit Corporation

Rostam is actively pursuing certification as a B Corporation. The duties of directors and officers should always extend to society and the environment rather than solely shareholders.

item.title: What We Do
item.dc:creator: goblin
item.content:encoded:
What We Do

Rostam is a team of lawyers, paralegals, accountants, and project management professionals that leverages technology to serve companies and individuals. We implement real life solutions for legal or project management problems by offering multidisciplinary professionals remotely or onsite, through our two forms of engagement

  • Attorney Engagement Rostam attorneys all have something in common, they’re retreats from the best law firms and companies, looking for a better way to perform legal services. Simply put, they believe Rostam has found “that” better way. More importantly, Rostam gives them sophisticated work, allows them to work closely with clients, and more autonomy over their practice.
  • Project Management Engagement Rostam’s Professional engagement does not end with their attorneys. Rostam offers an established network of vendors that can help our business clients save time, so that they can focus on the core of their business.

item.title: Our Attorneys
item.dc:creator: goblin
item.content:encoded:
Our Attorneys

Rostam utilizes attorneys with years of experience across multidisciplinary areas of law in order to meet a growing demand of specialized law. We realize each client matter is distinct, and therefore deserves its own customized legal services. Our virtual model ensures the elimination of all unnecessary overhead costs associated with traditional firms. This reduction in costs is passed to our clients.

The Founders

Rostam was conceived by close friends Michael Mulshine and Carlos De La Paz on the idea that law firms can become "total" efficient in regard to their clients, community, and environment. They believe law firm "total" efficiency can be achieved by cutting law firm overhead expenses while simultaneously providing a better work/life balance for the attorneys. They believe going virtual is a natural step in law firm evolution.

Carlos De La Paz, Founder & Of Counsel

When you hear Carlos explain his Oahu North Shore surfing expeditions you would not also believe that he is an avid corporate lawyer. After all, lawyers are typically risk adverse, right? Actually, Carlos believes that surfing has trained him to be a better lawyer.

"The attraction to surfing is the constant opportunity to make decisions that are crucial to the outcome of your safety...surfers understand the necessity of competent decision making in the most dire of moments in order to ensure a positive outcome. Decision making as a corporate lawyer is no different," explains Carlos. He believes decision making for material matters is intellectually challenging and only a few persons are up for the challenge. That challenge seems to be Carlos' main motivator.

Carlos has sought out intellectually challenging activities prior to graduating law school at the University of Illinois. As an accountant, he worked closely with casinos auditing their financial statements and ensuring their compliance with various gaming regulations. "One mistake can easily materially effect the operations of your casino clients, and in effect, thousands of jobs," he explains.

After graduating law school with honors, Carlos immediately began his legal career with the boutique litigation firm MoloLamken in New York City. He gained extensive experience with commercial litigation, corporate internal investigations, and complex e-discovery matters. His experience working with current technological trends and contract attorneys has shaped his ideology for the future of the legal industry.

Carlos now resides in Los Angeles managing the Rostam West Coast headquarters. He spends most of his free time honing his surfing skills and spending time with his wife and rescue dog.

Michael Mulshine, Founder & Of Counsel

Michael has never been a proponent of the traditional approach; instead his imagination has always been captivated by nature. Nature’s majesty captured Michael Mulshine at a young age, and it continues to serve as his intellectual inspiration. Although nature is full of struggle, nature has found a way to turn this suffering into a tool for constant improvement. Mimicking nature Michael is constantly seeking out new challenges to foster personal growth:

A man of character finds a special attractiveness in difficulty, since it is only by coming to grips with difficulty that he can recognize his potentialities.
-Charles de Gaulle.

Prior to attending law school Michael became a member of the National Paralegal Honor Society, however he was not satisfied. Michael graduated from the University Of Illinois College Of Law, with honors, and was privileged to work in the Risk Management department of Horizon Hobby Inc., while completing his studies.

Following law school Michael returned to Maryland, and joined WealthEngine, Inc., in Bethesda, where he served as Corporate Counsel. Michael currently manages Rostam’s East Coast headquarters, and resides in Rockville, Maryland.

Michael believes his experience as both a paralegal and attorney has given him a deeper understanding of the contemporary practice of law, and sees the problem of a new normal as Rostam’s opportunity:

Each problem has hidden in it an opportunity so powerful that it literally dwarfs the problem. The greatest success stories were created by people who recognized a problem a turned it into an opportunity.
- Joseph Sugarman

This unique perspective feeds Rostam’s hunger for innovation, focused on improving client outcomes while minimizing cost.

item.title: old what we do
item.dc:creator: goblin
item.content:encoded:
Rostam Service

Rostam is focused on finding efficient solutions to legal problems by leveraging technology and connecting clients with experienced attorneys.

Rostam’s Founders Carlos and Michael, respectively, cut their teeth as a business litigator and in-house counsel. Thus these areas still form the core of Rostam’s services; however Rostam also embraces a broader range of services, which include areas such as immigration and tax.

Rostam believes that the complexity of legal issues today can make collaboration essential. Rostam Project Management will coordinate the resolution of your issues, while seeking out the expertise to ensure the best outcomes.

Litigation

Virtual In-House Councel

General Practice

Project Management

Litigation

Rostam specializes in business litigation touching a broad range of issues: contract disputes, electronic discovery & document collection, personal injury & torts, securities & derivatives, tax controversies, unlawful detainer and many other types of disputes.

Virtual In-House Councel

Rostam provides your company with a legal function for the fraction of the cost of an internal attorney. Virtual In-house Counsel packages are specially tailored to meet the client’s needs, and can be scaled for any size business or type of need. Rostam attorneys can even work out of the client’s office, if desired. By centralizing legal infrastructure Rostam can provide a level of on demand service a single employee cannot replicate.

General Practice

Rostam is constantly expanding its experience base in the course of its representation. In order to best serve the client Rostam has gained experience in a broad range of legal fields, including immigration, real estate, non-profit entities and a number of other areas.

Project Management

Rostam’s professionals have a diverse range of experience that goes beyond the practice of law. Additionally, Rostam has established a network of relationships with vendors and other entities that can save you time. Rostam’s business start up services (including but not limited to entity formation, logo creation and website design) is a prime example of how Rostam Project Management can help you achieve your goals.

--

Don’t see what you were looking for? Contact Us, and let Rostam show what its comparative advantage can do for you: even if Rostam doesn’t know all the answers it knows where to get them!

item.title: Attorney Engagement
item.dc:creator: goblin
item.content:encoded:
Attorney Engagement

Litigation

Rostam’s Litigation Attorneys focus on a broad range of complex legal issues. From complex securities to simple private client matters, Rostam Attorneys rely on the use of technology, and streamlined e-discovery protocols, to lower the costs of litigation (without also lowering the quality of the attorney). Rostam Attorneys engage frequently with complex commercial litigation, white collar defense, class actions, securities litigation, labor and employment matters, insurance related litigation, tax matters, probate, and personal injury. Meet Chris (Link to Chris bio).

E-discovery

Litigation costs have spiraled out of control due to the increasing size of reviewable data. Discovery rules require attorneys to search many sources to uncover potential discoverable information. This includes emails, cloud based servers, smart phones, instant messaging, and many other potential sources. Rostam Attorneys understand cost savings occur by understanding the nuances of document collection and processing. Rostam Attorneys also understand the importance and use of algorithmic technology to cull down the size of reviewable data during discovery. Large scale “affordable” litigation is now a reality for our clients. Meet Carlos (link to Carlos bio).

Corporate

Corporate Formation

Rostam Attorneys (some of which also double as CPA’s) work closely with clients to truly understand their needs and end goals, and work to detect a wide range of issues early on in the representation, to offer up real solutions. No longer is it about the billable hour. Our Rostam team gets a nerdy sense of pride finding solutions for businesses and individuals. Rostam Attorneys and CPA’s have found solutions for sophisticated clients involving:

  • “S”, “C”, public, and closely held corporations
  • Partnerships and Joint Ventures
  • Limited Liability Companies
  • Sole proprietorships
  • Strategic Alliances
  • Tax-exempt Organizations
  • Trust Arrangements

Mergers & Acquisitions

Rostam Attorneys help our clients with small M&A transactions, joint venture transactions, and alliances. For large M&A transactions, Rostam offers the personnel to help manage information flow and due diligence, and work closely with outside counsel so our clients can focus on the core of their businesses.

Employment Law

Rostam Attorneys have a wide range of employment law experience. These areas include:

  • Breach of Contract
  • Sexual Harassment
  • Claim of Discrimination and Retaliation
  • Workers’ Compensation Claims Handling Defense
  • Employee Benefit Planning
  • Equity Compensation Packages
  • Unfair Competition
  • Misappropriation of Trade Secrets

Startups & Financing

The Rostam team gets a certain excitement from its entrepreneurial clients since the entrepreneurial spirit is what led to the idea and creation of Rostam Law. Rostam’s job is to pay attention to all details, legal and non-legal, that is involved with every start-up, so our entrepreneurs can focus on the core of their businesses. Some of the legal areas our start-up Attorneys cover are:

  • Corporate Formation
  • Corporate Governance
  • Technology licensing
  • Commercial Agreements
  • Employment & Labor Concerns
  • Tax Planning
  • Finance Planning, Negotiation, & Drafting

Intellectual Property

Intellectual Property Litigation

Rostam Intellectual Property Attorneys have multiple decades of experience in IP litigation matters with trial experience in federal courts. Services also include risk assessment and dispute resolution.

Patent & Trademark Procurement

Rostam Attorneys assist businesses and individuals procure patents and trademarks to protect their intellectual property.

Technology Licensing

Rostam Attorneys have counseled major corporations, start-ups, businesses, and individuals on technology licensing needs. Our clients have found it cheaper to outsource their attorney licensing needs to Rostam Attorneys, to handle both inbound and outbound licensing. These clients typically choose a fixed fee arrangement.

Tax & Estate Planning

Trusts and Estates

Rostam Attorneys have experience preparing wills and trusts instruments for high net worth individuals. Our Attorneys work closely with clients for a customized approach.

Tax

Some Rostam Attorneys double as CPA’s. This hybrid team allows Rostam to offer tax advice for an array of complex tax issues. Some of this advice relates to:

  • Corporate Tax
  • Personal Tax
  • Estate & Gift Tax
  • Real Estate Tax
  • State & Local Tax

item.title: Project Management Engagement
item.dc:creator: goblin
item.content:encoded:
Project Management Engagement

Professional Project Management

Our managers are experts with large team management. They can be deployed with short notice and can fit any large scale review project.

End-to-End Management

Rostam Professionals are inherently problem solvers. They get a nerdy sense of pride assisting companies streamline legal processes, such as regulatory compliance, commercial contracts, or technology licenses.
